CatDescriptText: Mr. Leslie Miller, station baggageman, 7134 Vann Drive, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 29, 1958, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that taverns should be permitted to remain open past midnight on Saturdays?" answer reads: "No, I think that to leave the taverns open after midnight would interfere with the people going to church on Sunday like the Catholics for instance. Also, some drunks would bother the women."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Leslie Miller, wearing button down coat with collar and lapels, dark suit jacket, plaid button down collared shirt, and dark hat, standing in front of Fanny Farmer Candies, with Raab clothing and Dimlings candy in background, Wood Street, Downtown
